questions.question: What are the different operations you can perform on a process?

explanations.a: It is a operation but not the only one that can be performed on  the process
explanations.b: It is a operation but not the only one that can be performed on  the process
explanations.c: It is a operation but not the only one that can be performed on  the process
explanations.d: All above processes can be performed

questions.question: When the process issues an I/O request :

answers.a: It is placed in the ready queue
answers.b: It is left in the CPU
answers.c: It is sent to the I/O queue

explanations.c: Process responds to I/O calls by going into the I/O queue to wait for data collection

questions.question: Which of the following state transitions is not possible?

explanations.a: Process can go to CPU from ready queue to push for execution
explanations.b: Process cant go from ready to I/O directly as the process needs to be in execution to get I/O calls so this state trnsition is not possible
explanations.c: Process can go directly from I/O queue to ready queue once it collects data
explanations.d: Process can be terminated from CPU so possible.

questions.question: Select the method in which a process leaves the CPU:

explanations.a: Possible but not the only way
explanations.b: Possible but not the only way
explanations.c: Possible but not the only way
